041package org.jfree.chart.renderer.xy;
042
043import java.awt.Font;
044import java.awt.Graphics2D;
045import java.awt.Paint;
046import java.awt.Shape;
047import java.awt.Stroke;
048import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
049import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
050import java.io.IOException;
051import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
052import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
053import java.io.Serializable;
054import java.util.Objects;
055
056import org.jfree.chart.legend.LegendItem;
057import org.jfree.chart.axis.ValueAxis;
058import org.jfree.chart.entity.EntityCollection;
059import org.jfree.chart.event.RendererChangeEvent;
060import org.jfree.chart.labels.ItemLabelAnchor;
061import org.jfree.chart.labels.ItemLabelPosition;
062import org.jfree.chart.labels.XYItemLabelGenerator;
063import org.jfree.chart.labels.XYSeriesLabelGenerator;
064import org.jfree.chart.plot.CrosshairState;
065import org.jfree.chart.plot.PlotOrientation;
066import org.jfree.chart.plot.PlotRenderingInfo;

068import org.jfree.chart.text.TextUtils;
069import org.jfree.chart.util.GradientPaintTransformer;
070import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleEdge;
071import org.jfree.chart.util.StandardGradientPaintTransformer;
072import org.jfree.chart.internal.CloneUtils;
073import org.jfree.chart.internal.Args;
074import org.jfree.chart.api.PublicCloneable;
075import org.jfree.chart.internal.SerialUtils;
076import org.jfree.chart.internal.ShapeUtils;

079import org.jfree.data.xy.XYDataset;
080
081/**
082 * A renderer that draws bars on an {@link XYPlot} (requires an
083 * {@link IntervalXYDataset}).  The example shown here is generated by the
084 * {@code XYBarChartDemo1.java} program included in the JFreeChart
085 * demo collection:
086 * <br><br>
087 * <img src="doc-files/XYBarRendererSample.png" alt="XYBarRendererSample.png">
088 */
089public class XYBarRenderer extends AbstractXYItemRenderer
090        implements XYItemRenderer, Cloneable, PublicCloneable, Serializable {
091
092    private XYBarRendererProduct3 xYBarRendererProduct3 = new XYBarRendererProduct3();
093
094        private XYBarRendererProduct2 xYBarRendererProduct2 = new XYBarRendererProduct2();
095
096        private XYBarRendererProduct xYBarRendererProduct = new XYBarRendererProduct();
097
098        /** For serialization. */
099    private static final long serialVersionUID = 770559577251370036L;
100
101    /**
102     * The default bar painter assigned to each new instance of this renderer.
103     */
104    private static XYBarPainter defaultBarPainter = new GradientXYBarPainter();
105
106    /**
107     * Returns the default bar painter.
108     *
109     * @return The default bar painter.
110     */
111    public static XYBarPainter getDefaultBarPainter() {
112        return XYBarRenderer.defaultBarPainter;
113    }
114
115    /**
116     * Sets the default bar painter.
117     *
118     * @param painter  the painter ({@code null} not permitted).
119     */
120    public static void setDefaultBarPainter(XYBarPainter painter) {
121        Args.nullNotPermitted(painter, "painter");
122        XYBarRenderer.defaultBarPainter = painter;
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * The default value for the initialisation of the shadowsVisible flag.
127     */
128    private static boolean defaultShadowsVisible = true;
129
130    /**
131     * Returns the default value for the {@code shadowsVisible} flag.
132     *
133     * @return A boolean.
134     *
135     * @see #setDefaultShadowsVisible(boolean)
136     */
137    public static boolean getDefaultShadowsVisible() {
138        return XYBarRenderer.defaultShadowsVisible;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Sets the default value for the shadows visible flag.
143     *
144     * @param visible  the new value for the default.
145     *
146     * @see #getDefaultShadowsVisible()
147     */
148    public static void setDefaultShadowsVisible(boolean visible) {
149        XYBarRenderer.defaultShadowsVisible = visible;
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * The state class used by this renderer.
154     */
155    protected class XYBarRendererState extends XYItemRendererState {
156
157        /** Base for bars against the range axis, in Java 2D space. */
158        private double g2Base;
159
160        /**
161         * Creates a new state object.
162         *
163         * @param info  the plot rendering info.
164         */
165        public XYBarRendererState(PlotRenderingInfo info) {
166            super(info);
167        }
168
169        /**
170         * Returns the base (range) value in Java 2D space.
171         *
172         * @return The base value.
173         */
174        public double getG2Base() {
175            return this.g2Base;
176        }
177
178        /**
179         * Sets the range axis base in Java2D space.
180         *
181         * @param value  the value.
182         */
183        public void setG2Base(double value) {
184            this.g2Base = value;
185        }
186    }
187
188    /** A flag that controls whether or not bar outlines are drawn. */
189    private boolean drawBarOutline;
190
191    /**
192     * An optional class used to transform gradient paint objects to fit each
193     * bar.
194     */
195    private GradientPaintTransformer gradientPaintTransformer;
196
197    /**
198     * The shape used to represent a bar in each legend item (this should never
199     * be {@code null}).
200     */
201    private transient Shape legendBar;
202
203    /**
204     * The default constructor.
205     */
206    public XYBarRenderer() {
207        this(0.0);
208    }
209
210    /**
211     * Constructs a new renderer.
212     *
213     * @param margin  the percentage amount to trim from the width of each bar.
214     */
215    public XYBarRenderer(double margin) {
216        super();
217        xYBarRendererProduct3.setMargin2(margin);
218        xYBarRendererProduct3.setBase2(0.0);
219        xYBarRendererProduct3.setUseYInterval2(false);
220        this.gradientPaintTransformer = new StandardGradientPaintTransformer();
221        this.drawBarOutline = false;
222        this.legendBar = new Rectangle2D.Double(-3.0, -5.0, 6.0, 10.0);
223        xYBarRendererProduct3.setBarPainter2(getDefaultBarPainter());
224        xYBarRendererProduct3.setShadowsVisible(getDefaultShadowsVisible());
225        xYBarRendererProduct.setShadowXOffset2(4.0);
226        xYBarRendererProduct.setShadowYOffset2(4.0);
227        xYBarRendererProduct3.setBarAlignmentFactor2(-1.0);
228    }
229
230    /**
231     * Returns the base value for the bars.
232     *
233     * @return The base value for the bars.
234     *
235     * @see #setBase(double)
236     */
237    public double getBase() {
238        return this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBase();
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * Sets the base value for the bars and sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent}
243     * to all registered listeners.  The base value is not used if the dataset's
244     * y-interval is being used to determine the bar length.
245     *
246     * @param base  the new base value.
247     *
248     * @see #getBase()
249     * @see #getUseYInterval()
250     */
251    public void setBase(double base) {
252        xYBarRendererProduct3.setBase(base, this);
253    }
254
255    /**
256     * Returns a flag that determines whether the y-interval from the dataset is
257     * used to calculate the length of each bar.
258     *
259     * @return A boolean.
260     *
261     * @see #setUseYInterval(boolean)
262     */
263    public boolean getUseYInterval() {
264        return this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getUseYInterval();
265    }
266
267    /**
268     * Sets the flag that determines whether the y-interval from the dataset is
269     * used to calculate the length of each bar, and sends a
270     * {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
271     *
272     * @param use  the flag.
273     *
274     * @see #getUseYInterval()
275     */
276    public void setUseYInterval(boolean use) {
277        xYBarRendererProduct3.setUseYInterval(use, this);
278    }
279
280    /**
281     * Returns the margin which is a percentage amount by which the bars are
282     * trimmed.
283     *
284     * @return The margin.
285     *
286     * @see #setMargin(double)
287     */
288    public double getMargin() {
289        return this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getMargin();
290    }
291
292    /**
293     * Sets the percentage amount by which the bars are trimmed and sends a
294     * {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
295     *
296     * @param margin  the new margin.
297     *
298     * @see #getMargin()
299     */
300    public void setMargin(double margin) {
301        xYBarRendererProduct3.setMargin(margin, this);
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Returns a flag that controls whether or not bar outlines are drawn.
306     *
307     * @return A boolean.
308     *
309     * @see #setDrawBarOutline(boolean)
310     */
311    public boolean isDrawBarOutline() {
312        return this.drawBarOutline;
313    }
314
315    /**
316     * Sets the flag that controls whether or not bar outlines are drawn and
317     * sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
318     *
319     * @param draw  the flag.
320     *
321     * @see #isDrawBarOutline()
322     */
323    public void setDrawBarOutline(boolean draw) {
324        this.drawBarOutline = draw;
325        fireChangeEvent();
326    }
327
328    /**
329     * Returns the gradient paint transformer (an object used to transform
330     * gradient paint objects to fit each bar).
331     *
332     * @return A transformer ({@code null} possible).
333     *
334     * @see #setGradientPaintTransformer(GradientPaintTransformer)
335     */
336    public GradientPaintTransformer getGradientPaintTransformer() {
337        return this.gradientPaintTransformer;
338    }
339
340    /**
341     * Sets the gradient paint transformer and sends a
342     * {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
343     *
344     * @param transformer  the transformer ({@code null} permitted).
345     *
346     * @see #getGradientPaintTransformer()
347     */
348    public void setGradientPaintTransformer(
349            GradientPaintTransformer transformer) {
350        this.gradientPaintTransformer = transformer;
351        fireChangeEvent();
352    }
353
354    /**
355     * Returns the shape used to represent bars in each legend item.
356     *
357     * @return The shape used to represent bars in each legend item (never
358     *         {@code null}).
359     *
360     * @see #setLegendBar(Shape)
361     */
362    public Shape getLegendBar() {
363        return this.legendBar;
364    }
365
366    /**
367     * Sets the shape used to represent bars in each legend item and sends a
368     * {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
369     *
370     * @param bar  the bar shape ({@code null} not permitted).
371     *
372     * @see #getLegendBar()
373     */
374    public void setLegendBar(Shape bar) {
375        Args.nullNotPermitted(bar, "bar");
376        this.legendBar = bar;
377        fireChangeEvent();
378    }
379
380    /**
381     * Returns the fallback position for positive item labels that don't fit
382     * within a bar.
383     *
384     * @return The fallback position ({@code null} possible).
385     *
386     * @see #setPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback(ItemLabelPosition)
387     */
388    public ItemLabelPosition getPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback() {
389        return this.xYBarRendererProduct2.getPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback();
390    }
391
392    /**
393     * Sets the fallback position for positive item labels that don't fit
394     * within a bar, and sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered
395     * listeners.
396     *
397     * @param position  the position ({@code null} permitted).
398     *
399     * @see #getPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback()
400     */
401    public void setPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback(
402            ItemLabelPosition position) {
403        xYBarRendererProduct2.setPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback(position, this);
404    }
405
406    /**
407     * Returns the fallback position for negative item labels that don't fit
408     * within a bar.
409     *
410     * @return The fallback position ({@code null} possible).
411     *
412     * @see #setNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback(ItemLabelPosition)
413     */
414    public ItemLabelPosition getNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback() {
415        return this.xYBarRendererProduct2.getNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback();
416    }
417
418    /**
419     * Sets the fallback position for negative item labels that don't fit
420     * within a bar, and sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered
421     * listeners.
422     *
423     * @param position  the position ({@code null} permitted).
424     *
425     * @see #getNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback()
426     */
427    public void setNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback(
428            ItemLabelPosition position) {
429        xYBarRendererProduct2.setNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback(position, this);
430    }
431
432    /**
433     * Returns the bar painter.
434     *
435     * @return The bar painter (never {@code null}).
436     */
437    public XYBarPainter getBarPainter() {
438        return this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarPainter();
439    }
440
441    /**
442     * Sets the bar painter and sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all
443     * registered listeners.
444     *
445     * @param painter  the painter ({@code null} not permitted).
446     */
447    public void setBarPainter(XYBarPainter painter) {
448        xYBarRendererProduct3.setBarPainter(painter, this);
449    }
450
451    /**
452     * Returns the flag that controls whether or not shadows are drawn for
453     * the bars.
454     *
455     * @return A boolean.
456     */
457    public boolean getShadowsVisible() {
458        return this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getShadowsVisible();
459    }
460
461    /**
462     * Sets the flag that controls whether or not the renderer
463     * draws shadows for the bars, and sends a
464     * {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
465     *
466     * @param visible  the new flag value.
467     */
468    public void setShadowVisible(boolean visible) {
469        xYBarRendererProduct3.setShadowVisible(visible, this);
470    }
471
472    /**
473     * Returns the shadow x-offset.
474     *
475     * @return The shadow x-offset.
476     */
477    public double getShadowXOffset() {
478        return this.xYBarRendererProduct.getShadowXOffset();
479    }
480
481    /**
482     * Sets the x-offset for the bar shadow and sends a
483     * {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
484     *
485     * @param offset  the offset.
486     */
487    public void setShadowXOffset(double offset) {
488        xYBarRendererProduct.setShadowXOffset(offset, this);
489    }
490
491    /**
492     * Returns the shadow y-offset.
493     *
494     * @return The shadow y-offset.
495     */
496    public double getShadowYOffset() {
497        return this.xYBarRendererProduct.getShadowYOffset();
498    }
499
500    /**
501     * Sets the y-offset for the bar shadow and sends a
502     * {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
503     *
504     * @param offset  the offset.
505     */
506    public void setShadowYOffset(double offset) {
507        xYBarRendererProduct.setShadowYOffset(offset, this);
508    }
509
510    /**
511     * Returns the bar alignment factor. 
512     * 
513     * @return The bar alignment factor.
514     */
515    public double getBarAlignmentFactor() {
516        return this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarAlignmentFactor();
517    }
518
519    /**
520     * Sets the bar alignment factor and sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent}
521     * to all registered listeners.  If the alignment factor is outside the
522     * range 0.0 to 1.0, no alignment will be performed by the renderer.
523     *
524     * @param factor  the factor.
525     */
526    public void setBarAlignmentFactor(double factor) {
527        xYBarRendererProduct3.setBarAlignmentFactor(factor, this);
528    }
529
530    /**
531     * Initialises the renderer and returns a state object that should be
532     * passed to all subsequent calls to the drawItem() method.  Here we
533     * calculate the Java2D y-coordinate for zero, since all the bars have
534     * their bases fixed at zero.
535     *
536     * @param g2  the graphics device.
537     * @param dataArea  the area inside the axes.
538     * @param plot  the plot.
539     * @param dataset  the data.
540     * @param info  an optional info collection object to return data back to
541     *              the caller.
542     *
543     * @return A state object.
544     */
545    @Override
546    public XYItemRendererState initialise(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
547            XYPlot plot, XYDataset dataset, PlotRenderingInfo info) {
548
549        XYBarRendererState state = new XYBarRendererState(info);
550        ValueAxis rangeAxis = plot.getRangeAxisForDataset(plot.indexOf(
551                dataset));
552        state.setG2Base(rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBase(), dataArea,
553                plot.getRangeAxisEdge()));
554        return state;
555
556    }
557
558    /**
559     * Returns a default legend item for the specified series.  Subclasses
560     * should override this method to generate customised items.
561     *
562     * @param datasetIndex  the dataset index (zero-based).
563     * @param series  the series index (zero-based).
564     *
565     * @return A legend item for the series.
566     */
567    @Override
568    public LegendItem getLegendItem(int datasetIndex, int series) {
569        XYPlot xyplot = getPlot();
570        if (xyplot == null) {
571            return null;
572        }
573        XYDataset dataset = xyplot.getDataset(datasetIndex);
574        if (dataset == null) {
575            return null;
576        }
577        LegendItem result;
578        XYSeriesLabelGenerator lg = getLegendItemLabelGenerator();
579        String label = lg.generateLabel(dataset, series);
580        String description = label;
581        String toolTipText = null;
582        if (getLegendItemToolTipGenerator() != null) {
583            toolTipText = getLegendItemToolTipGenerator().generateLabel(
584                    dataset, series);
585        }
586        String urlText = null;
587        if (getLegendItemURLGenerator() != null) {
588            urlText = getLegendItemURLGenerator().generateLabel(dataset, 
589                    series);
590        }
591        Shape shape = this.legendBar;
592        Paint paint = lookupSeriesPaint(series);
593        Paint outlinePaint = lookupSeriesOutlinePaint(series);
594        Stroke outlineStroke = lookupSeriesOutlineStroke(series);
595        if (this.drawBarOutline) {
596            result = new LegendItem(label, description, toolTipText,
597                    urlText, shape, paint, outlineStroke, outlinePaint);
598        }
599        else {
600            result = new LegendItem(label, description, toolTipText, urlText, 
601                    shape, paint);
602        }
603        result.setLabelFont(lookupLegendTextFont(series));
604        Paint labelPaint = lookupLegendTextPaint(series);
605        if (labelPaint != null) {
606            result.setLabelPaint(labelPaint);
607        }
608        result.setDataset(dataset);
609        result.setDatasetIndex(datasetIndex);
610        result.setSeriesKey(dataset.getSeriesKey(series));
611        result.setSeriesIndex(series);
612        if (getGradientPaintTransformer() != null) {
613            result.setFillPaintTransformer(getGradientPaintTransformer());
614        }
615        return result;
616    }
617
618    /**
619     * Draws the visual representation of a single data item.
620     *
621     * @param g2  the graphics device.
622     * @param state  the renderer state.
623     * @param dataArea  the area within which the plot is being drawn.
624     * @param info  collects information about the drawing.
625     * @param plot  the plot (can be used to obtain standard color
626     *              information etc).
627     * @param domainAxis  the domain axis.
628     * @param rangeAxis  the range axis.
629     * @param dataset  the dataset.
630     * @param series  the series index (zero-based).
631     * @param item  the item index (zero-based).
632     * @param crosshairState  crosshair information for the plot
633     *                        ({@code null} permitted).
634     * @param pass  the pass index.
635     */
636    @Override
637    public void drawItem(Graphics2D g2, XYItemRendererState state,
638            Rectangle2D dataArea, PlotRenderingInfo info, XYPlot plot,
639            ValueAxis domainAxis, ValueAxis rangeAxis, XYDataset dataset,
640            int series, int item, CrosshairState crosshairState, int pass) {
641
642        if (!getItemVisible(series, item)) {
643            return;
644        }
645        IntervalXYDataset intervalDataset = (IntervalXYDataset) dataset;
646
647        double value0;
648        double value1;
649        if (this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getUseYInterval()) {
650            value0 = intervalDataset.getStartYValue(series, item);
651            value1 = intervalDataset.getEndYValue(series, item);
652        } else {
653            value0 = this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBase();
654            value1 = intervalDataset.getYValue(series, item);
655        }
656        if (Double.isNaN(value0) || Double.isNaN(value1)) {
657            return;
658        }
659        if (value0 <= value1) {
660            if (!rangeAxis.getRange().intersects(value0, value1)) {
661                return;
662            }
663        } else {
664            if (!rangeAxis.getRange().intersects(value1, value0)) {
665                return;
666            }
667        }
668
669        double translatedValue0 = rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(value0, dataArea,
670                plot.getRangeAxisEdge());
671        double translatedValue1 = rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(value1, dataArea,
672                plot.getRangeAxisEdge());
673        double bottom = Math.min(translatedValue0, translatedValue1);
674        double top = Math.max(translatedValue0, translatedValue1);
675
676        double startX = intervalDataset.getStartXValue(series, item);
677        if (Double.isNaN(startX)) {
678            return;
679        }
680        double endX = intervalDataset.getEndXValue(series, item);
681        if (Double.isNaN(endX)) {
682            return;
683        }
684        if (startX <= endX) {
685            if (!domainAxis.getRange().intersects(startX, endX)) {
686                return;
687            }
688        } else {
689            if (!domainAxis.getRange().intersects(endX, startX)) {
690                return;
691            }
692        }
693
694        // is there an alignment adjustment to be made?
695        if (this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarAlignmentFactor() >= 0.0 && this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarAlignmentFactor() <= 1.0) {
696            double x = intervalDataset.getXValue(series, item);
697            double interval = endX - startX;
698            startX = x - interval * this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarAlignmentFactor();
699            endX = startX + interval;
700        }
701
702        RectangleEdge location = plot.getDomainAxisEdge();
703        double translatedStartX = domainAxis.valueToJava2D(startX, dataArea,
704                location);
705        double translatedEndX = domainAxis.valueToJava2D(endX, dataArea,
706                location);
707
708        double translatedWidth = Math.max(1, Math.abs(translatedEndX
709                - translatedStartX));
710
711        double left = Math.min(translatedStartX, translatedEndX);
712        if (getMargin() > 0.0) {
713            double cut = translatedWidth * getMargin();
714            translatedWidth = translatedWidth - cut;
715            left = left + cut / 2;
716        }
717
718        Rectangle2D bar = null;
719        PlotOrientation orientation = plot.getOrientation();
720        if (orientation.isHorizontal()) {
721            // clip left and right bounds to data area
722            bottom = Math.max(bottom, dataArea.getMinX());
723            top = Math.min(top, dataArea.getMaxX());
724            bar = new Rectangle2D.Double(
725                bottom, left, top - bottom, translatedWidth);
726        } else if (orientation.isVertical()) {
727            // clip top and bottom bounds to data area
728            bottom = Math.max(bottom, dataArea.getMinY());
729            top = Math.min(top, dataArea.getMaxY());
730            bar = new Rectangle2D.Double(left, bottom, translatedWidth,
731                    top - bottom);
732        }
733
734        boolean positive = (value1 > 0.0);
735        boolean inverted = rangeAxis.isInverted();
736        RectangleEdge barBase;
737        if (orientation.isHorizontal()) {
738            if (positive && inverted || !positive && !inverted) {
739                barBase = RectangleEdge.RIGHT;
740            } else {
741                barBase = RectangleEdge.LEFT;
742            }
743        } else {
744            if (positive && !inverted || !positive && inverted) {
745                barBase = RectangleEdge.BOTTOM;
746            } else {
747                barBase = RectangleEdge.TOP;
748            }
749        }
750        
751        if (state.getElementHinting()) {
752            beginElementGroup(g2, dataset.getSeriesKey(series), item);
753        }
754        if (getShadowsVisible()) {
755            this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarPainter().paintBarShadow(g2, this, series, item, bar, barBase,
756                !this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getUseYInterval());
757        }
758        this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarPainter().paintBar(g2, this, series, item, bar, barBase);
759        if (state.getElementHinting()) {
760            endElementGroup(g2);
761        }
762
763        if (isItemLabelVisible(series, item)) {
764            XYItemLabelGenerator generator = getItemLabelGenerator(series,
765                    item);
766            drawItemLabel(g2, dataset, series, item, plot, generator, bar,
767                    value1 < 0.0);
768        }
769
770        // update the crosshair point
771        double x1 = (startX + endX) / 2.0;
772        double y1 = dataset.getYValue(series, item);
773        double transX1 = domainAxis.valueToJava2D(x1, dataArea, location);
774        double transY1 = rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(y1, dataArea,
775                plot.getRangeAxisEdge());
776        int datasetIndex = plot.indexOf(dataset);
777        updateCrosshairValues(crosshairState, x1, y1, datasetIndex,
778                transX1, transY1, plot.getOrientation());
779
780        EntityCollection entities = state.getEntityCollection();
781        if (entities != null) {
782            addEntity(entities, bar, dataset, series, item, 0.0, 0.0);
783        }
784
785    }
786
787    /**
788     * Draws an item label.  This method is provided as an alternative to
789     * {@link #drawItemLabel(Graphics2D, PlotOrientation, XYDataset, int, int,
790     * double, double, boolean)} so that the bar can be used to calculate the
791     * label anchor point.
792     *
793     * @param g2  the graphics device.
794     * @param dataset  the dataset.
795     * @param series  the series index.
796     * @param item  the item index.
797     * @param plot  the plot.
798     * @param generator  the label generator ({@code null} permitted, in
799     *         which case the method does nothing, just returns).
800     * @param bar  the bar.
801     * @param negative  a flag indicating a negative value.
802     */
803    protected void drawItemLabel(Graphics2D g2, XYDataset dataset,
804            int series, int item, XYPlot plot, XYItemLabelGenerator generator,
805            Rectangle2D bar, boolean negative) {
806
807        if (generator == null) {
808            return;  // nothing to do
809        }
810        String label = generator.generateLabel(dataset, series, item);
811        if (label == null) {
812            return;  // nothing to do
813        }
814
815        Font labelFont = getItemLabelFont(series, item);
816        g2.setFont(labelFont);
817        Paint paint = getItemLabelPaint(series, item);
818        g2.setPaint(paint);
819
820        // find out where to place the label...
821        ItemLabelPosition position;
822        if (!negative) {
823            position = getPositiveItemLabelPosition(series, item);
824        } else {
825            position = getNegativeItemLabelPosition(series, item);
826        }
827
828        // work out the label anchor point...
829        Point2D anchorPoint = calculateLabelAnchorPoint(
830                position.getItemLabelAnchor(), bar, plot.getOrientation());
831
832        if (isInternalAnchor(position.getItemLabelAnchor())) {
833            Shape bounds = TextUtils.calculateRotatedStringBounds(label,
834                    g2, (float) anchorPoint.getX(), (float) anchorPoint.getY(),
835                    position.getTextAnchor(), position.getAngle(),
836                    position.getRotationAnchor());
837
838            if (bounds != null) {
839                if (!bar.contains(bounds.getBounds2D())) {
840                    if (!negative) {
841                        position = getPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback();
842                    }
843                    else {
844                        position = getNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback();
845                    }
846                    if (position != null) {
847                        anchorPoint = calculateLabelAnchorPoint(
848                                position.getItemLabelAnchor(), bar,
849                                plot.getOrientation());
850                    }
851                }
852            }
853
854        }
855
856        if (position != null) {
857            TextUtils.drawRotatedString(label, g2,
858                    (float) anchorPoint.getX(), (float) anchorPoint.getY(),
859                    position.getTextAnchor(), position.getAngle(),
860                    position.getRotationAnchor());
861        }
862    }
863
864    /**
865     * Calculates the item label anchor point.
866     *
867     * @param anchor  the anchor.
868     * @param bar  the bar.
869     * @param orientation  the plot orientation.
870     *
871     * @return The anchor point.
872     */
873    private Point2D calculateLabelAnchorPoint(ItemLabelAnchor anchor,
874            Rectangle2D bar, PlotOrientation orientation) {
875
876        Point2D result = null;
877        double offset = getItemLabelAnchorOffset();
878        double x0 = bar.getX() - offset;
879        double x1 = bar.getX();
880        double x2 = bar.getX() + offset;
881        double x3 = bar.getCenterX();
882        double x4 = bar.getMaxX() - offset;
883        double x5 = bar.getMaxX();
884        double x6 = bar.getMaxX() + offset;
885
886        double y0 = bar.getMaxY() + offset;
887        double y1 = bar.getMaxY();
888        double y2 = bar.getMaxY() - offset;
889        double y3 = bar.getCenterY();
890        double y4 = bar.getMinY() + offset;
891        double y5 = bar.getMinY();
892        double y6 = bar.getMinY() - offset;
893
894        if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.CENTER) {
895            result = new Point2D.Double(x3, y3);
896        }
897        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE1) {
898            result = new Point2D.Double(x4, y4);
899        }
900        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE2) {
901            result = new Point2D.Double(x4, y4);
902        }
903        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE3) {
904            result = new Point2D.Double(x4, y3);
905        }
906        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE4) {
907            result = new Point2D.Double(x4, y2);
908        }
909        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE5) {
910            result = new Point2D.Double(x4, y2);
911        }
912        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE6) {
913            result = new Point2D.Double(x3, y2);
914        }
915        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE7) {
916            result = new Point2D.Double(x2, y2);
917        }
918        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE8) {
919            result = new Point2D.Double(x2, y2);
920        }
921        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE9) {
922            result = new Point2D.Double(x2, y3);
923        }
924        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE10) {
925            result = new Point2D.Double(x2, y4);
926        }
927        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE11) {
928            result = new Point2D.Double(x2, y4);
929        }
930        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE12) {
931            result = new Point2D.Double(x3, y4);
932        }
933        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE1) {
934            result = new Point2D.Double(x5, y6);
935        }
936        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE2) {
937            result = new Point2D.Double(x6, y5);
938        }
939        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE3) {
940            result = new Point2D.Double(x6, y3);
941        }
942        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE4) {
943            result = new Point2D.Double(x6, y1);
944        }
945        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE5) {
946            result = new Point2D.Double(x5, y0);
947        }
948        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE6) {
949            result = new Point2D.Double(x3, y0);
950        }
951        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE7) {
952            result = new Point2D.Double(x1, y0);
953        }
954        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE8) {
955            result = new Point2D.Double(x0, y1);
956        }
957        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE9) {
958            result = new Point2D.Double(x0, y3);
959        }
960        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE10) {
961            result = new Point2D.Double(x0, y5);
962        }
963        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE11) {
964            result = new Point2D.Double(x1, y6);
965        }
966        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE12) {
967            result = new Point2D.Double(x3, y6);
968        }
969
970        return result;
971
972    }
973
974    /**
975     * Returns {@code true} if the specified anchor point is inside a bar.
976     *
977     * @param anchor  the anchor point.
978     *
979     * @return A boolean.
980     */
981    private boolean isInternalAnchor(ItemLabelAnchor anchor) {
982        return anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.CENTER
983               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE1
984               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE2
985               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE3
986               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE4
987               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE5
988               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE6
989               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE7
990               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE8
991               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE9
992               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE10
993               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE11
994               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE12;
995    }
996
997    /**
998     * Returns the lower and upper bounds (range) of the x-values in the
999     * specified dataset.  Since this renderer uses the x-interval in the
1000     * dataset, this is taken into account for the range.
1001     *
1002     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
1003     *
1004     * @return The range ({@code null} if the dataset is
1005     *         {@code null} or empty).
1006     */
1007    @Override
1008    public Range findDomainBounds(XYDataset dataset) {
1009        return findDomainBounds(dataset, true);
1010    }
1011
1012    /**
1013     * Returns the lower and upper bounds (range) of the y-values in the
1014     * specified dataset.  If the renderer is plotting the y-interval from the
1015     * dataset, this is taken into account for the range.
1016     *
1017     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
1018     *
1019     * @return The range ({@code null} if the dataset is
1020     *         {@code null} or empty).
1021     */
1022    @Override
1023    public Range findRangeBounds(XYDataset dataset) {
1024        return findRangeBounds(dataset, this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getUseYInterval());
1025    }
1026
1027    /**
1028     * Returns a clone of the renderer.
1029     *
1030     * @return A clone.
1031     *
1032     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException  if the renderer cannot be cloned.
1033     */
1034    @Override
1035    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
1036        XYBarRenderer result = (XYBarRenderer) super.clone();
1037                result.xYBarRendererProduct3 = (XYBarRendererProduct3) this.xYBarRendererProduct3.clone();
1038                result.xYBarRendererProduct2 = (XYBarRendererProduct2) this.xYBarRendererProduct2.clone();
1039                result.xYBarRendererProduct = (XYBarRendererProduct) this.xYBarRendererProduct.clone();
1040        if (this.gradientPaintTransformer != null) {
1041            result.gradientPaintTransformer = CloneUtils.clone(this.gradientPaintTransformer);
1042        }
1043        result.legendBar = CloneUtils.clone(this.legendBar);
1044        return result;
1045    }
1046
1047    /**
1048     * Tests this renderer for equality with an arbitrary object.
1049     *
1050     * @param obj  the object to test against ({@code null} permitted).
1051     *
1052     * @return A boolean.
1053     */
1054    @Override
1055    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1056        if (obj == this) {
1057            return true;
1058        }
1059        if (!(obj instanceof XYBarRenderer)) {
1060            return false;
1061        }
1062        XYBarRenderer that = (XYBarRenderer) obj;
1063        if (this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBase() != that.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBase()) {
1064            return false;
1065        }
1066        if (this.drawBarOutline != that.drawBarOutline) {
1067            return false;
1068        }
1069        if (this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getMargin() != that.xYBarRendererProduct3.getMargin()) {
1070            return false;
1071        }
1072        if (this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getUseYInterval() != that.xYBarRendererProduct3.getUseYInterval()) {
1073            return false;
1074        }
1075        if (!Objects.equals(this.gradientPaintTransformer, that.gradientPaintTransformer)) {
1076            return false;
1077        }
1078        if (!ShapeUtils.equal(this.legendBar, that.legendBar)) {
1079            return false;
1080        }
1081        if (!Objects.equals(this.xYBarRendererProduct2.getPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback(), that.xYBarRendererProduct2.getPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback())) {
1082            return false;
1083        }
1084        if (!Objects.equals(this.xYBarRendererProduct2.getNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback(), that.xYBarRendererProduct2.getNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback())) {
1085            return false;
1086        }
1087        if (!this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarPainter().equals(that.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarPainter())) {
1088            return false;
1089        }
1090        if (this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getShadowsVisible() != that.xYBarRendererProduct3.getShadowsVisible()) {
1091            return false;
1092        }
1093        if (this.xYBarRendererProduct.getShadowXOffset() != that.xYBarRendererProduct.getShadowXOffset()) {
1094            return false;
1095        }
1096        if (this.xYBarRendererProduct.getShadowYOffset() != that.xYBarRendererProduct.getShadowYOffset()) {
1097            return false;
1098        }
1099        if (this.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarAlignmentFactor() != that.xYBarRendererProduct3.getBarAlignmentFactor()) {
1100            return false;
1101        }
1102        return super.equals(obj);
1103    }
1104
1105    /**
1106     * Provides serialization support.
1107     *
1108     * @param stream  the input stream.
1109     *
1110     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1111     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
1112     */
1113    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream)
1114            throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
1115        stream.defaultReadObject();
1116        this.legendBar = SerialUtils.readShape(stream);
1117    }
1118
1119    /**
1120     * Provides serialization support.
1121     *
1122     * @param stream  the output stream.
1123     *
1124     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1125     */
1126    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
1127        stream.defaultWriteObject();
1128        SerialUtils.writeShape(this.legendBar, stream);
1129    }
